coredata.dc:title: Raman band shapes of small diatomic molecules dissolved in inert liquids
coredata.dc:creator: Le Duff, Y
Holzer, W
coredata.dc:description:
Abstract
The experimental results obtained on four different types of Raman spectra: pure rotational lines, the IVV and VH components of the vibrational Q-branch and the vibrational rotational lines are presented for H2, D2, HF and N2 dissolved at low concentration in inert solvents. The line broadening and motional narrowing due to the solvent interaction is discussed.

head.ce:title: Raman band shapes of small diatomic molecules dissolved in inert liquids

ce:affiliation.ce:textfn: Département des Recherches Physiques, Laboratoire associé au CNRS, Université de Paris VI, 75230 Paris, Cédex 05, France

ce:abstract-sec.ce:simple-para: The experimental results obtained on four different types of Raman spectra: pure rotational lines, the IVV and VH components of the vibrational Q-branch and the vibrational rotational lines are presented for H2, D2, HF and N2 dissolved at low concentration in inert solvents. The line broadening and motional narrowing due to the solvent interaction is discussed.
